messages.message: Ah, I suspect one of the services is crash-looping. To debug this, you can look at the status of each service in the logs (`cs logs`  or the sandbox UI).
You can also look at the *Probes* section to see which service is failed:

```➜  ~ cs logs -f api-server
✔ select the only one - DAEMON:api-server@instabase
make: Entering directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server'
mkdir -p /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/py
rm -f /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/pydeps.txt
rm -f /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/pythriftdeps.txt
rm -f /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/protodeps.txt
make -s list-deps >> /home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/build/pydeps.txt
make[1]: python: No such file or directory
make[1]: *** [/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:85: list-deps] Error 127
make: *** [/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server/../../shared-utils/build-utils/shared/build-python.mk:113: copy-py-deps] Error 2
make: Leaving directory '/home/owner/instabase/webserver/api-server'```
No Python on the path? Possible personal customization error :slightly_smiling_face:. Check your `~/.bashrc`  and `$PATH` variable
